Key Match Events: Harry Kane opened the scoring for England from close range in the 18th minute
Morten Hjulmand's scorching 30-yard drive secured a draw for Denmark just after the half-hour
Phil Foden hit a post in the second half
Pierre-Emile HÃ¸jbjerg shaped a curler for the far corner in the 85th minute but was off target
Jarrod Bowen, Ollie Watkins, and Eberechi Eze brought something in their places, but England still struggled
Pre-Game Insights: The hope had been when Kane put them ahead that they could settle but they did not
Southgate had demanded care with the passing. It did not happen
Who was buying that in Frankfurt? England were favourites to win but struggled
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate accepts blame for England draw and admits 'level has to be higher'
The manager raised eyebrows when he withdrew his front three of Bukayo Saka, Harry Kane, and Foden on 70 minutes but the first two could not complain
Southgate had demanded care with the passing. It did not happen
Miscellaneous Highlights: The turf was a problem for many players, including Kyle Walker, who slipped over twice in the early running and rolled his ankle on the second occasion
Denmark's Morten Hjulmand's rocket was extraordinary in power and precision
Others: England lacked structure and progressive patterns in midfield
The control was not there and nor was the belief. They looked edgy, the pressure weighing heavily
